intro: Erica woodii var. rhodesiaca, commonly known as the Rhodesian heath, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
